General.Name: CeoTronics AG
General.Description: CeoTronics AG provides systems for mobile digital radio networks and end devices used in local applications, and professional communications headsets and intercom systems in Germany. The company offers CT-adapter for radios; intercom-systems, such as CT-DECT case, CT-DECT GateCom compact, and CT-DECT multi products; and remote units comprising CT-MultiPTT 1C, CT-MultiPTT 1C Plus, CT-MultiPTT 2C, CT-MultiPTT 3C, CT-WirelessPTT MIL, CT-MultiCom, and CT-HR PTT. It also provides headsets, such as CT-ActionNeckband Headset, a helmet-independent neckband headset; CT-ClipCom and CT-ClipCom Digital with PSA, an in-ear communication system; CT-CombiCom, a modular on-ear headset; CT-DECT systems for short-range communication needs; CT-EarGuard, a mobile measurement system; CT-Earpieces, an individual ear molds; CT-HN Headset, an over-ear headset; CT-Neckband Headset to wear under helmet; CT-SkullMike, a receiver/talk system with skullcap microphone; CT-ThroatMike Comfort for use in full protection suits; CT-VibrationSpeaker Heads that enables communication in quiet and loud environments; and CT-WireCom Digital Headset, a wired digital full-duplex communications system. The company's products and systems are used in fire brigades, police forces, airports, the military, energy suppliers, nuclear, aerospace, and other industries. It sells its products to approximately 40 countries worldwide. CeoTronics AG was founded in 1985 and is headquartered in Rödermark, Germany.
